thread.title: APT Named a Finalist in the SmartCEO Cornerstone Awards
thread.title_full: APT Named a Finalist in the SmartCEO Cornerstone Awards

author: Cathy Baker
title: APT Named a Finalist in the SmartCEO Cornerstone Awards
text:
Applied Predictive Technologies (APT) today announced that the company has been named a finalist in the SmartCEO Cornerstone Awards. The Arlington-based predictive analytics company currently serves clients in over a dozen industries in more than 25 countries around the world, delivering cloud-based software to help enable data-driven decision-making. The Cornerstone Awards program honors businesses headquartered in the communities surrounding the Baltimore, Philadelphia and Washington, DC metro markets. Companies are judged based on their positive impact on job creation and retention, market competition, and philanthropy. APT was recognized for its various contributions to Arlington, including its philanthropic endeavors, local client and vendor relationships, and contributions to the county’s economy. For instance, over the past couple of years, APT has hosted a series of “data dives” and partnered with local organizations to conduct a series of high-value analyses. Recent Data Dive partners include the Capital Area Food Bank and Apple Tree Institute. In addition, APT recently formed a 501(c)(3) non-profit ‘APT Charities,’ which provides funding directly to local organizations that have a demonstrated need and specific goals, including those that engage in or could benefit from data-driven solutions.
Jaime Nespor-Zawmon, President of SmartCEO Events, stated, “It’s no secret that Greater Washington is home to some of the region’s most impactful companies. Moreover, they have become part of the fabric of the communities in which they reside. These companies are economic drivers, innovators and exemplary community stewards — they are true cornerstones of their communities. For that, we honor them.”
APT CEO Anthony Bruce commented, “We are honored to receive this award.”
Read the recent profile of APT in SmartCEO Magazine here: http://www.smartceo.com/2015-washington-cornerstone-applied-predictive-technologies/ .
About APT
APT is a leading cloud-based analytics software company that enables organizations to rapidly and precisely measure cause-and-effect relationships between business initiatives and outcomes to generate economic value. Our intuitive and proprietary Test & Learn® software utilizes sophisticated algorithms to analyze large amounts of data, enabling business leaders to conduct experiments and allowing them to make optimal decisions and implement business initiatives at scale. We also offer products that support decision-making for specific business needs including transaction analysis, space planning, promotion design, category management and location selection. APT’s client portfolio features some of the world’s best known brands, including Walmart, Starbucks, Coca-Cola, Victoria’s Secret, American Family, Hilton Hotels, SUBWAY, TD Bank, T-Mobile, and others. APT has offices in Washington, D.C., San Francisco, London, Bentonville, Taipei, Tokyo, Sydney, and Chicago. Visit http://www.predictivetechnologies.com to learn more.
About the Cornerstone Awards
The Cornerstone Awards program honors businesses headquartered in the communities surrounding the Baltimore, Philadelphia and Washington, DC, metro markets. These companies are not only economic drivers, they are also exemplary stewards. Finalists include companies of all sizes and industry segments — whether brought to their locale by a new business venture, a relocation or an expansion, these companies have made a positive impact on job creation and retention, market competition and philanthropy. Finalists were profiled in the July/August issue of SmartCEO magazine and celebrated at an awards luncheon with more than 200 attendees in August, where individual winners were announced.
About SmartCEO
SmartCEO’s mission is to educate and inspire the business community through its award-winning magazine, connections at C-level events and access to valuable online resources. SmartCEO’s integrated media platforms reach decision makers in the Baltimore, New York, Philadelphia and Washington, DC, metropolitan areas. To find out more about the 2016 Cornerstone Awards nomination process, email us at DCprograms(at)smartceo(dot)com.
